Description:
Cool cutting-edge conversion
This striking multi-level factory conversion, designed by Re:Construction Pty Ltd in the heart of the funky Gertrude/Smith St precinct delivers a contemporary residence distinguished by dramatic spaces, soaring ceilings, polished concrete and timber floors. Flooded with light, it comprises three bedrooms, a home office/study, designer kitchen, three stylish bathrooms, a garage and screened private terrace. With hydronic heating, ducted air conditioning, concealed laundry and ample storage, this finely crafted property features a custom-built central steel staircase and a huge north-facing window protected by remote-controlled louvres.
Agent - hockingstuart
Michael Amarant : 0411 144 569
Insights: 24 other 3 bedroom house in Collingwood have recently been sold.

Description:
Immaculate Style, Private And Secure
This masterbuilt contemporary apartment at the rear of a boutique block of 5 is a standout opportunity in a quiet street close to Smith St cafes, Queens Parade and transport. Exceptionally quiet and private, it offers a very spacious living and dining room flowing to a wide al fresco entertaining terrace with vertical garden, custom kitchen (Smeg appliances, stone benchtops and glass splashbacks), and 2 double bedrooms (BIRs) separated by a stylish bathroom/laundry with walk-in shower. Including designated secure parking and separate storeroom, this light-filled property features reverse-cycle air conditioning and polished timber floors. Nelson Alexander Pty Ltd.
Insights: 3/26 Ballarat Street, Collingwood VIC 3066 was last sold in 2016 and 83 other 2 bedroom unit in Collingwood have recently been sold.

Description:
Spacious & Stylish In Every Sense
A huge full-width family living zone overlooking secluded entertainers' garden is one of the many great surprises to be discovered beyond the broad facade and rosy frontage of this attractive three bedroom block-fronted Victorian. Nestled in a wide, tree-lined street handy to a host of inner-city hotspots, this superbly renovated freestanding home offers the utmost privacy throughout light-filled spaces. Featuring ducted heating, air-conditioning, alarm system, period detail and polished hardwood floors; this spacious single-level residence comprises arched hallway, open-plan living/dining under cathedral ceiling, fully-appointed kitchen, central bathroom, laundry and retractable awning covering alfresco deck in a wonderful landscaped setting. Moments to Smith & Brunswick Streets, schools, Yarra River trails and train station.
Julie Susnjara : 0408 006 662

Description:
Iconic, Individual Loft-Style Townhouse
The Smith Street pharmacist who built this now heritage listed, solid brick building as his laboratory back in the 1880's could never in his wildest imagination have foreseen the superb conversion that has created the totally cool 2 bedroom loft-style townhouse that now occupies the space.
Although part of the development at 77 Little Oxford Street, No.1 has a completely separate and secure street level entrance which opens onto a generous living space flooded with natural light from the floor to ceiling glass walled private courtyard. On the mezzanine level the bedroom includes an ensuite bathroom and walk-in robe while the ground floor bedroom has a built-in robe and the ensuite incorporates a recessed laundry. The open plan kitchen features a Caeserstone island bench, Nobel stainless steel gas appliances, tiled splashback and ample storage.
Other features include split system air-conditioning, floating timber flooring, secure single car space and storage cage.
Adding to the appeal of this highly desirable property is an ideal location in the heart of the Oxford Street precinct and within easy walking distance of Smith Street with its cafes, restaurants, bars, specialty shops and supermarket while either a short tram or bike ride will have you in the CBD or neighbouring Fitzroy.
The savvy owner-occupier or investor may also want to consider the option to gain excellent returns from listing the property with Airbnb as the current owner has done, achieving Super Host status, and with guests regularly commenting on how they love the brilliant location, the direct street access, the courtyard and clever mezzanine design.
Michael Furlong : 0425 713 571
Insights: 83 other 2 bedroom unit in Collingwood have recently been sold.

Description:
Compelling Architect designed quality on the City's edge
A coveted position in the historic Victorian Distillery showcases an outstanding transformation by Kister Architects of this remarkable 2-level warehouse quietly located on the East Melbourne fringe. Bespoke design, sublime finishes, copious storage and flexible light-filled spaces underpin one of the area's best contemporary conversions.
Totalling 5 principal rooms this remarkable dwelling incorporates a number of large open-plan spaces, luxury kitchen (4m concrete bench, Miele induction, soft-close drawers/cupboards), 2 brilliant bathrooms, 3 separate alfresco areas, large laundry, hydronic heating, air-conditioning, TV/data points, LED lighting, Spotted Gum floors, double-glazing and secure covered car space.
Stroll to Gertrude Street, Fitzroy Gardens, trams and the CBD from this stunning energy-efficient dwelling. Note: Commercial 2 zoning.
Insights: 3B/26 Wellington Street, Collingwood VIC 3066 was last sold in 2016 and 18 other 3 bedroom unit in Collingwood have recently been sold.

Description:
Exclusive Inner City Investment
Prime opportunity exists, to secure your foothold into one of the Inner North’s most popular postcodes.
Located right in the heart of the wholesale fashion district, is this sensational contemporary abode.
Boasting a smart design open plan living/dining, 2 bedrooms (BIR’s), well appointed kitchen with stone bench tops, stainless steel appliances (dishwasher) European style laundry and central bathroom.
Featuring balcony/terrace for entertaining, split system heating/cooling, security entrance, handy storage cage and remote garage parking.
A sleek boutique block of only 6, the apartment is perfectly positioned around the corner from the lifestyle mecca of Smith and Gertrude Street’s many bars, restaurants, cafes and designer retail experience.
Note: Securely leased at $450pw until Feb 2017

Description:
City style and spectacular views
Making the most of its prime position and elevated vantage, this top-floor apartment epitomizes the appeal of inner-city living with its designer details, northern panorama and enviable East Melbourne-edge convenience. Light-filled interior comprises 2 double bedrooms (both with robes) and stylish central bathroom, open living/dining area leading out to a full-width terrace ideal for entertaining and enjoying the fabulous views across Collingwood's skyline all the way to the Dandenong Ranges. Add to this a superb stone-bench kitchen with Fisher & Paykel appliances (including induction cooktop), split-system heating and cooling, plus lift access, secure foyer and lower-level car space. Set in a boutique block just north of Victoria Parade, it's also walking distance to Gertrude Street / Smith Street cafes and restaurants, local shops, Fitzroy Gardens and trams to the CBD.

Description:
Timeless style, contemporary flair
Classic Victorian character, free-flowing design and enviable location all combine in this semi-detached terrace delivering a ready-made lifestyle of quality and convenience in a coveted Collingwood pocket close to everything that counts. Bathed in natural light, the home's immaculate interior boasts 2 double bedrooms (both with robes) and updated bathroom, front lounge through to the open dining area and well-appointed kitchen with dishwasher and stylish timber benchtops. Add to this gas heating and split-system air conditioning, high ceilings, fresh carpets, internal laundry facilities, plus a sizeable yet delightfully private backyard complete with handy storage shed. Perfectly positioned, it's close to cafes and restaurants, shopping precincts, easy freeway access, trams and trains to the CBD. Move in and start living!

Description:
Sophia Terrace (c1876)
Located in one of Collingwood's finest row of heritage terraces.This Victorian offers a divine mix of period character and contemporary style situated in a sublime streetscape with East Melbourne-edge prestige and inner-city convenience. Beyond its distinctive triple-arched facade with recessed arcade, the home's elegant and inviting interior boasts three spacious upstairs bedrooms (all with robes) and stylish bathroom. Downstairs: formal lounge and dining, stone-bench kitchen with double dishwasher and open family/meals area with double doors revealing a wonderfully private entertainers' courtyard complete with pergola, leafy surrounds and exclusive ROW access. Add to this a second bathroom, concealed laundry, hydronic heating and split-system a/c, open fireplaces, high ornate ceilings and polished timber floors. Stroll to Smith Street/Gertrude Street cafes and restaurants, Victoria Parade trams and Fitzroy Gardens.

Description:
More than just a pretty face
Located in vibrant Collingwood this 1880s two bedroom brick Victorian home is impressive from the street and offers so much more as you step inside. A fabulous floorplan is the key to the home with two good sized bedrooms each with built in robes, a central bathroom, separate laundry and powder room followed by a light filled rear extension with high ceilings and windows affording fabulous light into the living zones. The home is completed by a fully paved and landscaped area with ROW access and potential for OSP. Presented in good order with potential to further update and renovate. Superbly located close to Smith, Victoria, & Gertrude St's, Queens Parade, Abbotsford Convent, Victoria Park Station and so much more.

Description:
JUST MOVE IN, HOW EASEY IS THAT!
Renovated, north-facing spacious apartment in a most ideal location.
- Generous light-filled bedroom with built in robe
- Spacious north-facing open plan living and dining area with views, floorboards, gas heating
- Well equipped entertainer's kitchen, loads of storage
- Sleek bathroom with ensuite access; Shower over bath; Internal laundry facilities
- Secure lock-up garage; Secure entrance with intercom
- Refurbished boutique block
Famous Easey Street Burgers only 200m up the road. Minutes' walk to Smith Street's wide variety of well-known cafes and restaurants. A short stroll to Carlton Gardens or jump on a tram and be in the heart of the city within minutes.
Conditions of entry - IDENTIFICATION and contact number required, otherwise entry may be refused.

Description:
Chic pad in one of Melbourne's most popular locales!
Oversized and perfectly positioned close to some of Melbourne's best food & dining precincts such as Gertrude, Smith & Victoria Streets, this property will forever be attractive to both investors & owner occupiers looking to secure outstanding returns or long-term capital growth.
Bathed in natural light this apartment also features:
- Massive living/dining that opens out on to a sunny balcony
-Spacious bedroom with built in wardrobe
- Two reverse cycle air conditioning units
- Full size kitchen with ample storage, gas cooking & stainless steel appliances
-Extra storage inside the unit
-Modern spacious bathroom complete with laundry
- Underground secure car park & security swipe access with intercom
- Public transport at your door
- on-site building manager
Ideally located moments from the CBD, MCG, beautiful parks & gardens, Universities, Hospitals, Melbourne's best restaurants & bars, with only a short stroll to Collingwood, this apartment really is the perfect place to call home.
Enquire today; do not let this opportunity pass you by!
Information on outgoings: cityresidential.harcourts.com.au/Home/Buy/Outgoing-Summaries
our blog: harcourtscityresidential.wordpress.com
website: cityresidential.harcourts.com.au
Before you buy a home, you should be aware of a range of issues that may affect that property and impose restrictions or obligations on you, if you buy it. Harcourts City Residential suggests that all buyers read the due diligence checklist available on our website:
cityresidential.harcourts.com.au/Home/Buy/Due-diligence-checklist

Description:
Retro cool from top to bottom
Located on Collingwood's finest tree lined street this 1st floor brick 70s style apartment offers a wonderful blend of retro style and modern appointment. Renovated with both style and substance the apartment offers modern light filled living courtesy of big north facing windows and is ready made for a carefree lifestyle. Comprises 2 bedrooms, central bathroom, modern open plan living with fully updated kitchen, euro laundry, ample storage, security entry and more. A stunning roof top deck and separate garage are two additional standout features further enhancing lifestyle or investment opportunities. Moments from Smith & Brunswick St's with Collingwood Children's Farm, Victoria Park,
Abbotsford Convent and more just on the doorstep.
Agent - hockingstuart
Michael Amarant : 0411 144 569

Description:
VICTORIAN TERRACE WITH A TOUCH OF CLASS
Superbly updated with an architecturally designed renovation, this classic Victorian terrace takes advantage of natural light and boasts magnificent period features just a short walk from Collingwood's funky shops, cafes, parks and schools. With glorious high ceilings, polished floorboards and 100 per cent wool carpets in its three generous bedrooms, it offers a spacious feel throughout, with a beautifully finished first-floor master bedroom that has double-glazed windows and an ensuite. The stylish lounge boasts three exquisite stained-glass windows and opens into a light-filled kitchen with Technika oven, stone benches and access through large glass sliding doors to the established Japanese-style garden, which includes a soothing water feature. Other highlights are off-street parking from Little Abbot St, wall heater, ample storage and picture rails throughout.
Insights: 153 Keele Street, Collingwood VIC 3066 was last sold in 2015 and 24 other 3 bedroom house in Collingwood have recently been sold.
